*div1 type="summary"* *p*Henry Austin to Austin, New Orleans, March 4, 1831. Plans to interest capitalists in cotton mills in Texas. His own plans for railroad and a contract to furnish live-oak timber for British Navy.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-04-1831">March 4th 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear Sir*/p*
*p*I wrote you two long letters by the last vessels to *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, chiefly on my own subject. The main object of this is to acquaint you with some propositions made to me here which I think may be directed to the interests of the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*and also to your own. *person_mentioned*Mr N A Ware*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Philada */location_mentioned*who has lately sold his *location_mentioned*plantation on this river*/location_mentioned* proposes to invest forty thousand dollars in a*location_mentioned* cotton manufactory */location_mentioned*in the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, provided he can have permission to do so, a piece of land for the establishment and your countenance and support to the enterprise. He says *person_mentioned*Mr Boys*/person_mentioned* reports having obtained the exclusive right for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, in consideration of establishing a *location_mentioned*cotton mill*/location_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*which he is now going about. I do not believe this to be true, you can ascertain. *person_mentioned*Mr Ware*/person_mentioned* does not propose to go out immediately himself but to send a confidential and experienced man to erect the establishment, in whose name the location might be made. I have told him I thought it probable yon would be much pleased to have such an establishment erected and so far from seeing any difficulty in obtaining permission, I had no doubt you would give it all the encouragement in your power, and obtain for him an encreas'd *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*of land proportionate to the magnitude of the enterprise say 5. 6 or more leagues, perhaps as far as 11 He then said if you would do so he would send in immediately a thousand spindles with the force and capital necessary for the operation, and a sufficient number of young *person_mentioned*negroes */person_mentioned*under indentures to secure the permanent running of the mill, and give you such a share of the net profits as you should judge reasonable for obtaining an encreas'd quantity of land (over one league) say one eighth or one tenth. He would prefer erecting the *location_mentioned*mill on a water course*/location_mentioned* to use water power if it could be done in a secure and healthy position without going too far from the *location_mentioned*coast */location_mentioned*otherwise would use steam. I think it would be desirable to have it near *location_mentioned*S. Filippe*/location_mentioned* if practicable to encourage the growth of cotton in that *location_mentioned*quarter */location_mentioned*and help build up the *location_mentioned*town */location_mentioned*on the subject oflocation you can give him the best advice. He appears to be a sound man and has a large capital laying idle*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr William Taylor */person_mentioned*our late *person_mentioned*Consul at *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* is now here *person_mentioned*Mr Ware*/person_mentioned* was introduced to me by him. *person_mentioned*Mr Taylor*/person_mentioned* has retired from *location_mentioned*Mexican */location_mentioned*business with forty or fifty thousand dollars and appears to be at loss how to invest his money. *person_mentioned*Mr Ware*/person_mentioned* proposed to him to join in his *location_mentioned*Texas manufacturing project*/location_mentioned*, which he immediately assented to, and desired me to request of you to address a copy of your letter to *person_mentioned*Mr Ware*/person_mentioned*, to him.*person_mentioned* Mr Ware*/person_mentioned* will leave this for *location_mentioned*Philada */location_mentioned*in four or five weeks and as it is uncertain how long I shall remain here, as I only wait advices from you to determine my future course; I have told him I would request you to write directly to him on the subject and at foot I give you his address also that of *person_mentioned*Mr Taylor*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*This is not a new project of *person_mentioned*Mr Ware*/person_mentioned*s, he has given his attention to the subject for some time and has better information respecting the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*than any man I have ever met with.*/p*
*p*On my own subject, I shall get to the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*in some mode if my solicitation be granted and shall not engage in anything until I know the fate of it. My wish would then be to go to *location_mentioned*England */location_mentioned*if I could raise capital enough, to make arrangements for a direct trade,—to procure my equipment and goods at the first *location_mentioned*European cost*/location_mentioned*, with *person_mentioned*english artizans*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*laborers */person_mentioned*to erect my *location_mentioned*buildings */location_mentioned*etc at a cheap rate—and at the same time see what could be done with live oak timber, *location_mentioned*rail road*/location_mentioned* etc. If a contract could be made for supplying live oak for *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*His Majesty*/person_mentioned*s Dockyard*/location_mentioned* it would throw great wealth into the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*. There is a *location_mentioned*rail road building*/location_mentioned* here, such an one might be built in the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*at an expense of 3,000$ pr mile, 3/4 of which expense would be in the Iron ways, which might be dispensed with; a *location_mentioned*railroad */location_mentioned*of live oak would not cost over 1,000$ per mile. I wish you would advise me of your intentions respecting the *location_mentioned*Hawkins lands*/location_mentioned*, it occurs to me that if you were to set off the *location_mentioned*lands on the east side of the river*/location_mentioned* it might interfere materially with any arrangement for live oak—besides circumstances might render it advisable to purchase their right or the lands when set off Who is their *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*here ?*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Europe */location_mentioned*is in a very disturbed state and in all probability we shall soon have a general war there, revolution in *location_mentioned*Spain */location_mentioned*and very possibly in *location_mentioned*Ireland */location_mentioned*if not in *location_mentioned*England*/location_mentioned*, These circumstances will drive a large amount of *person_mentioned*European */person_mentioned*capital and labor to *location_mentioned*this side of the ocean */location_mentioned*if matters can be managed in the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*to preserve tranquillity and security and the policy of the Govt continues to be liberal *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*will spring into importance with astonishing rapidity.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Henry Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I give you the address of *person_mentioned*Mr. W */person_mentioned*on the envelope*/p*
*/div1*
